sentences: Terve öö ta aeles unetult asemel.
Lapsed aelesid ning hullas värsketes heintes.
Poisist pole töömeest – joob ja aeleb küla mööda.
context: The word 'järgmist' appears to be part of the longer compound verb 'aelema'. Based on the dictionary definitions, 'aelema' means to move about restlessly, toss and turn in bed, writhe from pain or discomfort, or wander aimlessly. It typically describes involuntary movements due to restlessness, discomfort, or agitation. The word can refer to physical movement (tossing/turning in bed) as well as wandering around.
